thread.title: Chip Kelly: Eagles two missed field goals from being 3-1
thread.title_full: Chip Kelly: Eagles two missed field goals from being 3-1 | OregonLive.com

author: Geoffrey C. Arnold | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Chip Kelly: Eagles two missed field goals from being 3-1
text:
Philadelphia coach Chip Kelly has come under increasing criticism after the Eagles' loss to Washington dropped them to a 1-3 record to begin the season.
Kelly looks at the Eagles slow start differently, taking a glass half-full perspective.
''You hit two kicks and we are sitting here 3-1 and everybody's happy,'' Kelly told reporters Monday.
Kelly is referring to placekicker Caleb Sturgis - signed last Monday after a season-ending injury to Cody Parkey - missing a 33-yard field goal and an extra point in the 23-20 loss at Washington Sunday. Parkey missed a field goal in the fourth quarter of their 26-24 loss at Atlanta in Week 1.
Kelly remains committed to his style, philosophy and personnel. He dismissed any criticism about his controversial personnel moves during the offseason.
''I think we have the right guys, and we're doing the right things,'' Kelly said. ''We need to execute the plays better. That's what we need to do.''
The Eagles offense continues it's inconsistency. The offense has played well in the first half and second half of games, but the unit has put it all together for an entire game. Quarterback Sam Bradford looks as if he's still not comfortable in the offense and star running back DeMarco Murray complained about not getting enough touches after the loss at Washington.
"You either make plays or you don't make plays," Kelly said. "And if you're not making plays, you have to continue to work on them so you can make the plays.''
On the bright side, the Eagles trail first-place Dallas, Washington and the New York Giants by one game in the NFC East. Kelly has been quick to remind people the 2013 Eagles team started the season 1-3 before rebounding and winning the division title.
-- Geoffrey C. Arnold | @geoffreyCarnold
